intro: Brachystegia randii, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
